Inn Fang wrote:

>
> Hi
>
> I am novice to the ARC file format. I read about the ARC file format
> and also notice there is ARCReader class for use to parse the ARC
> file.
>
> The main method in ARCReader:
> java org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader [--offset=#] ARCFILE
>
> Where to find out the offset?

One way of generating the offset is to run the ARCReader against an arc; 
By default it prints out a line per record with stats such as offset, 
mimetype, size, etc.

>
> do I need to chmod the ARCReader in bin folder to be executable?

Yes.

>
> if i have a file name aaa.arc.gz and offset say is 100, I shall write:
> java org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader [--offset=100] aaa.arc.gz?
>
No.

Do this:

$ cd $HERITRIX_HOME
$ chmod u+x ./bin/arcreader
$ ./binarcreader --help

This will output usage information.

And:

$ ./bin/arcreader aaa.arc.gz

...will print a line of vitals per ARC record.

Later, to get a single record, do this:

$ ./bin/arcreader --offset=122828322 aaa.arc.gz

You might find this section of the developer manual, 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#arcs, of 
interest if you haven't seen it already.

Also, ARCReader in HEAD has a few more features regards output.

St.Ack

> Are there any other details guides or instructions to follow?
>
> Thanks,
> Inn Fang
